thread.title: Iran bans international chess siblings from competing | Daily Mail Online
thread.title_full: Iran bans international chess siblings from competing | Daily Mail Online

author: Kelly Mclaughlin For Mailonline
title: Iran bans international chess siblings from competing | Daily Mail Online
text: Iran bans international chess siblings from competing in tournaments after one played against an Israeli and his sister refused to wear a hijab Dorsa and Borna Derakhshan are two of Iran's leading youth chess players They were told they can no longer be part of the national team or copmete in the country's tournament after competing at the Tradewise Gibraltar Chess Festival Dorsa, an 18-year-old student in Spain, was banned after she did not wear a hijab Her 15-year-old brother, Borna, was told he couldn't compete after playing against Israeli chess player Alexander Husman during the same tournament
